title: Configure git upstream on feature branch creation

task.title: Configure git upstream on feature branch creation
task.description:
When build-plan creates a feature branch, it doesn't set upstream tracking, causing `git push` to fail with "fatal: The current branch has no upstream branch." Users must manually run `git push --set-upstream origin <branch>` before subsequent pushes work. This friction breaks the autonomous workflow where agents should be able to push changes without manual git intervention.

**Implementation Steps:**
1. Locate the feature branch creation logic in build-plan (likely in `cub.core.launch` or a related module that handles git operations)
2. After creating the local branch, immediately configure upstream tracking by either:

commits.message: task(cub-n6x.4): Configure git upstream on feature branch creation

outcome.approach: Added upstream tracking configuration to the `create_run_branch()` function in `git_ops.py` by executing two `git config` commands after branch creation. This sets the branch's remote and merge refs locally without requiring the remote branch to exist, enabling `git push` to work without the `--set-upstream` flag during autonomous workflows.
decisions: Used `git config branch.<name>.remote origin` and `git config branch.<name>.merge refs/heads/<name>` instead of `git push -u` to avoid network dependencies and allow push to work before remote branch exists
Implemented tracking configuration as a private helper function `_configure_upstream_tracking()` for reusability and clean separation of concerns
Updated existing tests rather than creating isolated test cases, maintaining consistency with the test suite's existing patterns for the `create_run_branch()` function
lessons_learned: For autonomous workflows, prefer local git configuration (config commands) over remote operations (push --set-upstream) to avoid external dependencies and enable workflows where remote branches haven't been created yet
When modifying functions that call `subprocess.run()`, update all existing tests that mock subprocess calls, not just tests for the new behavior, to prevent test failures from unexpected calls
The `git config branch.<name>.merge` ref format requires the full `refs/heads/` prefix, not just the branch name, for proper upstream tracking configuration
